instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: MacbookPro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-04 Stuck at 5V.
threads.message:
Hi
Got <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-04 stuck at 5V.
found little moisture around <CHIP>U3500</CHIP> but did not find any damaged or shorted component.

UB300 and UB400 are providing stable 5V but <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> and <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> are fluctuating between 1.65 and 5V in every 6-7 seconds.

I have tried with known good controller but same issue. All the LDOs on both ICs are also fluctuating. <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> also fluctuating.

threads.title: MacbookPro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-04 Stuck at 5V.
threads.message: Compare diode mode readings around all <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips.
